Package game

Class Summary
Area A grid of Tiles in the game, also known as a map.
BagPresenter I display the player's backpack, one of the the four pockets at a time.
Ball  
Battle A Presenter for a battle between the player and a rival trainer or a wild pokemon
BattleBox Displays the player's party (the up to six pokemon with him) in the context of a battle.
Battler  
Citizen You can talk to them, but not battle.
EncounterSet A set of species and the probablities the player will encouter each for pokegrass/Cave/Water.
Entity Something interactive that may occupy a Tile, such as a citizen, rival trainer, the player, or a pickup item.
Game The shell for a game, a window containing a presenter.
GridMenuPresenter Do not use this class directly, use the showMenu methods inherited on Presenters.
HM  
HueCyclePresenter  
Item a thing in your pack
ItemBox displays the players's collection of items (the up to six items with him in the context of a battle.
KeyItem  
LearnItem Generalization of a TM or HM.
Lottery  
MenuPresenter Do not use this class directly, use the showMenu methods inherited on Presenters.
MessagePresenter Do not use this class directly, use the showMessage method inherited on Presenters.
Move  
Node This class should be renamed XmlElement after it is compliant (element names will be case senstive); parser/generator of a simplified version of xml; node names are case-insenstive; a stanza is a top level node of a document (not used in pokemon)
Pack Contains maps of all of the pockets which contains the Items and the quantity of each
PickupItem  
Player You.
Pokeball  
Pokedex Keeps track of which pokemon have been caught and seen.
PokedexPresenter Displays the in game Pokedex.
PokedexSpeciesPresenter Displays a species details for the pokedex.
Pokemon A particular pokemon owned by the player or a rival trainer.
PokemonBox  
Presenter An area, battle, or menu that is the root to be displayed and receiver of key events; this is perhaps the most important class.
RarePokemon A wild pokemon of which there is only one that appears in game as a person to talk to: Mewtwo, Zapdos, Articono, Moltres.
RegularItem  
Species A prototype for generating a wild pokemon, evolving a pokemon, or viewing pokedex data.
StartPresenter  
StatsPresenter What you see select stats from a party menu.
Talker You.
Tile I am one square in an Area; I have a image, type and target; I might contain an Entity.
TM  
XmlElement Functional successor to Node which uses correct XML terminology; element names are case senstive and may not contains spaces.
 

Enum Summary
Button Buttons on a GB
Direction A typesafe represention of direction.
Status  
Type
